abstract: Four times a year, fans of Warren Buffett — and there are a lot of them — rush to see which stocks his Berkshire Hathaway has bought in the latest quarter, in hopes of getting a good investment tip or two. Last week, there was a flurry of excitement about CarMax, the seller of used cars, because it appeared that the legendary investor had added nearly 14 million CarMax shares to his portfolio. That was enough to send CarMax’s stock price soaring 7.5 percent in much heavier-than-normal trading.
lead_paragraph: Four times a year, fans of Warren Buffett — and there are a lot of them — rush to see which stocks his Berkshire Hathaway has bought in the latest quarter, in hopes of getting a good investment tip or two. Last week, there was a flurry of excitement about CarMax, the seller of used cars, because it appeared that the legendary investor had added nearly 14 million CarMax shares to his portfolio. That was enough to send CarMax’s stock price soaring 7.5 percent in much heavier-than-normal trading.

headline.main: Buffett and CarMax: Less Than Meets the Eye?
